author: bjbr-dev
body:
## Steps to reproduce

```powershell
PS > $foo = docker -v
```

## Expected behavior
I expect the variable $foo to contain the string `Docker version 19.03.11, build dd360c7` since running `docker -v` like below returns that data
```powershell
PS > docker -v
Docker version 19.03.11, build dd360c7
```

## Actual behavior

It errors
```none
write /dev/stdout: permission denied
```

## Environment data

```none
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.1.0
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.1.0
OS                             Linux 5.8.0-33-generic #36-Ubuntu SMP Wed Dec 9…
Platform                       Unix
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0


Ubuntu version: 20.10
Installed powershell with Snap
```

I originally raised this as a stackoverflow question -> https://stackoverflow.com/questions/65260463/how-to-capture-docker-version-in-powershell-cross-platform but I believe it is a bug. 

The equivalent code works in bash 

```
#> VERSION=$(docker -v)
#> echo $VERSION
```

I believe it also works on Ubuntu 20.04 when pwsh is installed with apt-get, but as fair as I can tell you can only install pwsh with snap on 20.10

comments.author: mklement0
comments.body:
Just to highlight crucial information: It sounds like the problem is the `snap` package, specifically, possibly related to [sandboxing](https://core.docs.ubuntu.com/en/guides/intro/security).

Also, can you please update the title of this issue to make it descriptive?

comments.author: bjbr-dev
comments.body:
Apologies, I missed the ability to set the issue name first time round - updated.

I agree, it does seem to be something about the snap package - I believe it works when powershell is installed with apt-get. Unfortunately this doesn't seem possible for Ubuntu 20.10, only for Ubuntu 20.04 and below

title: Permission denied when trying to read stdout of another program in Snap
